name: Grand Harbor District
culture_adjustments: heightened cosmopolitanism; heavy loanwords in local Coastal Tongues
merchant-guild authority supersedes civic councils on port law
tide-based schedules enforced as legal time for commerce
practical literacy extends into dockcrafts and augur apprentices
patrilineal house patronage organized around dock gangs
constraints: limited hinterland for expansion; density-driven logistics
pier access and repair controlled by guild charters
ritual magic reliant on imported reagents (scarce)
navigational auguries cannot replace seamanship or charts
notes: nightly bell-tide marks official closing of cargo gates
major node for imported reagents used by state augurs
